message_1: Given the predicate P(x) = "x is a prime number" and the domain of discourse is {2,3,4,5,6,7,8}, write the negation of the statement: "All elements in the domain of discourse are prime numbers".
message_2:
The negation of the statement "All elements in the domain of discourse are prime numbers" can be written as "There exists an element in the domain of discourse that is not a prime number."

Using the predicate P(x) and the domain of discourse {2,3,4,5,6,7,8}, the negation can be formally written as:

∃x ∈ {2,3,4,5,6,7,8}, ¬P(x)
